channel.title: BCEL question w<forward slash...> access flags
channel.description: How do you add more than one access flag? I<apostrophe>m trying to dynamically generate a Bot class with an artificial main method, but I can only add one access flag (Constants.ACC_PUBLIC, and I want Constants.ACC_STATIC as well). Help apprecicated.[br][size=1]Posted at: August 17, 2006, 12:36:52 PM[/size][hr]Gah, I feel stupid. Who thought it could have been something as mundane as adding ACC_PUBLIC and ACC_STATIC together? :|

item.title: BCEL question w<forward slash...> access flags
item.dc:creator: @White_Castle White Castle
item.description:
@White_Castle wrote:

Thanks. Wonder why it worked :P.

Read full topic
item.source: BCEL question w<forward slash...> access flags

item.title: BCEL question w<forward slash...> access flags
item.dc:creator: @NOURLOL NOURLOL
item.description:
@NOURLOL wrote:

You shouldn’t be adding the flags together, even if it works.

Constants.ACC_PUBLIC | Constants.ACC_STATIC etc, bitwise OR operator.

Reason for this is, when checking for access flags with:

if((bitMask & Constants.ACC_PUBLIC) != 0)

If you ADD the masks together, something’s gonna break.

Read full topic

item.description:
@sdouble wrote:

By the way, I had like 15 .pdfs open and somehow that broke my apostrophe/single quote and forward slash it seems. After I closed all of them and my web browser (they were all opened inside of firefox) it worked again. I win. And you stole my quote for your signature.
